intro: Secamone schatzii, commonly known as the Schatz's secamone, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Secamone schatzii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments.
